node.title: In the Michigan School Shooting, the Prosecutor Asks, What About the Parents?
node.description: After seeing the evidence, Karen McDonald made an instinctual, and unusual, decision to charge Ethan Crumbley’s mother and father. Can she succeed?

node.title: U.S. to Pull Out of Carbon Projects Overseas Entirely for First Time Following Biden Order
node.description: The U.S. will still fund projects in vulnerable areas in need of expanded energy access.

node.title: Antisemitic Graffiti Found on Mount Holyoke College Campus Likely Done By Student: School
node.description: Mount Holyoke College in Massachusetts reported its third case of antisemitic graffiti since October, all in bathrooms of the same on-campus residence hall.

node.title: South Carolina House Backpedals on Banning Companies From Firing Unvaxxed Employees
node.description: The South Carolina House passed a bill banning a COVID-19 vaccine mandate for state and local government employees and students at public schools.

node.title: Beijing Winter Olympics boycott is insignificant, says Macron
node.description: France has no plans to join a diplomatic boycott of the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing, President Emmanuel Macron has said.

node.title: Michael Nesmith, Monkees singer-songwriter, has died at 78
node.description: Michael Nesmith died of heart failure at his home in California, The Monkees' record label, Rhino Records, confirmed to CBS News.

node.title: Scuba-Diving YouTuber Finds Car Linked to Teens Missing Since 2000
node.description: A YouTuber who investigates cold cases found a missing Tennessee teenager’s car submerged in a nearby river. It is at least the fourth such discovery by amateur investigators in two months.

node.title: Police Report Reveals More Details Into Demaryius Thomas' Death
node.description: "It was apparent from rigor mortis that Demaryius was deceased," the Roswell Police incident report said.

node.title: Australia Head and shoulders above England
node.description: Travis Head smashed the third fastest century in Ashes history to put Australia in control of the first test in Brisbane.

node.title: Russian Teacher Reportedly Fired Over NSFW Instagram Post
node.description: "Please do not post such explicit videos, or close [your social media]," asked one student's mother of the teacher.

node.title: TikToker's Viral Encounter With 'Pokémon' Turns Out to Be Venomous Sea Slug
node.description: The tiny creature is known for its vibrant blue coloring and is not venomous alone but stores stinging cells from its preferred prey, the Portuguese man o' war

node.title: A green energy retailer's bleeding customers after a buyout by Shell. Will people power win?
node.description: Green energy provider Powershop has likely lost at least 5,000 customers since a takeover announcement by Shell a few weeks ago, according to data collected by the ABC from its competitors.

node.title: An increasing number of Taiwanese people want independence, but they're in no rush
node.description: The threat of conflict has raised the question of Taiwan's independence, but it's a complicated issue. So what do Taiwanese Australians think?

node.title: A desperate PM, an old sparring partner and a simple calculation: How Morrison got it wrong
node.description: Leveraging Gladys Berejiklian's personal popularity with punters was always politically opportunistic for Scott Morrison, made more interesting by the fact that from many accounts the two could barely stand each other, writes political correspondent Brett Worthington.

node.title: Are we caught in a game of snakes and ladders with coronavirus variants?
node.description: A pattern of borders opening and then closing has become a familiar one over the past 22 months, threatening economic recovery and leaving citizens fatigued. Is it a sign we will always live with restrictions and uncertainty?

node.title: Sea the past: Otago Museum to host prehistoric beasts
node.description: New exhibitions at the museum will feature real fossils that are millions of years old and life-sized fossil casts up to 13 metres long. Audio

node.title: The Inflation Suspense Goes On
node.description: The data refuse to settle the big debate.

node.title: Mexico Migrant Truck Crash Leaves at Least 54 Dead
node.description: Over 100 others were reported injured in the crash in southern Chiapas State, where many migrants regularly cross into Mexico from Central America.

node.title: Controversial Seattle Councilmember Kshama Sawant Appears to Survive Recall Vote
node.description: Kshama Sawant, known for her outspokenness on her socialist ideals, appears to have narrowly missed efforts to recall her, with 50.3 percent voting against it.

node.title: Why we continue to marvel at the wildflowers of the west
node.description: Each year, winter rains turn the dusty landscape of WA's Midwest into a rich tapestry of colours, smells and sounds. When the flowers come out, so do the people, who connect with the flowers in their own way.

node.title: Surfing in India is taking off, but locals are on the frontline of the world's plastic pollution crisis
node.description:
The connection with the ocean that many of India's new surfers are feeling comes with a heightened awareness that many of the country's coastal waters are in trouble.




but its new adoptees are coming face to face with the world's ocean plastic pollution crisis.

node.title: Forget plus-ones — COVID takes the cake for awkward wedding RSVP etiquette
node.description: Couples racing to get married in the US are now navigating awkward conversations with family and friends about how to stay COVID safe at their weddings.

node.title: Jon Ronson Seeks the Clashes That Led to the Culture Wars
node.description: In his podcast “Things Fell Apart,” the writer looks to conflicts from past decades to help us understand America’s current fault lines.

node.title: Death Toll Climbs to 55 After Truck Jammed With Estimated 200 Migrants Crashes in Mexico
node.description: "We have been insisting that the causes that originate these unfortunate events must be addressed," Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador said.

node.title: De Blasio Could Enter Favorable Position in NY Governor Race After Letitia James Departure
node.description: James's departure as the most formidable opponent to Governor Kathy Hochul has opened up the slot for a second-place favorite.

node.title: Omicron Variant That May Resist Vaccines Found in Majority of U.S. States
node.description: Experts believe cases will continue to rise, and researchers are working to determine how much of a threat Omicron poses.

node.title: Viewers Split After Mom Says 'Whole Family' Attends Birthday Parties Regardless of Invites
node.description: "Each child deserves their own individual experiences without their siblings," countered one viewer.

node.title: Hillary Clinton Trying to 'Inject' Herself As 2024 Candidate, Jason Miller Says
node.description: The former Trump adviser's remarks came after Clinton for the first time publicly shared what she would have said in her victory speech if she'd won in 2016.

node.title: Judge bars Steve Bannon from releasing trial material to the public
node.description: Bannon faces two counts of criminal contempt of Congress.

node.title: Putin, Patron of European Unity? At This Art Exhibition, He Is.
node.description: Russia’s president is an unlikely backer for a roving art show that asks questions about what it means to be European — and whether Russia really is.
